description.narrative: Stora Enso Oyj (Stora Enso or the sponsor), the worlds largest paper and board producer in produced tonnes and number three sawn timber producer, has approached IFC for a loan facility to finance the development of its timber plantation and related investments in China. China is the second largest and fastest growing paper market in the world, yet it is critically short of timber/fiber. China accounts for over 1/3 of the total increase in global paper capacity for the period 2001-2006, however the countrys short supply of fiber has led it to import unsustainably harvested fiber from neighbors such as Russia or the Pacific Rim. Stora Ensos current projects in China include expanding its plantation in the Guangxi province of Southern China, which began operating in 2002 as well as a paper mill in Suzhou, which was acquired by Stora Enso in 1998. Stora Enso plans to further develop both operations, with an immediate financing need to help development of their plantation. These investment projects, combined with Stora Ensos other possible investment projects in China comprise an estimated $125 million investment program over the next five years. Stora Enso has thus requested IFC for a flexible debt facility for to help it with its investment program financing needs.

mailing-address.narrative: In Suzhou: Jukka Kantola, Managing Director, Stora Enso Suzhou Paper Co., Ltd., 600 Binhe Road Suzhou New District, 215011, Jiangsu, China In Guangxi: Kari Tuomela, President, Stora Enso Guangxi, Rm. 1102, Investment Building, 109 Minzu Avenue, Nanning, Gyangxi, 530022 China

name.narrative: Stora Ensos plantations are located in the Guangxi province, primarily in five counties on or near Guangxis coastal areas. The headquarters of Stora Enso Guangxi is located in the capital city of Guangxi province, Nanning, and its operational headquarter for the plantation operation locates in Beihai city. The plantations are located in rural locations which have primarily been used for forestry and/or agricultural plantations. Stora Ensos paper mill is located on an industrial site in an industrial region of the city of Suzhou, some 160 kilometers west of Shanghai.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
